revised_title: Hybridisation and the Influence of Conditions on Dominance
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on hybrid Echinoid larvae to determine if the dominance of a character is influenced by the condition of the genital cells at the time of fertilisation. They found that adverse conditions acting on the eggs gave rise to differences in the larvae, but these differences were not due to a change in the dominance of characters. The authors also showed that seasonal changes observed by Vernon were likely due to differences in temperature and not a change in dominance accompanying maturity.
